name: Glen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Book it. Before the pandemic, I traveled a lot. I have never seen a place as spic and span as this completely mother-in-law unit attached to the main house. This is a standard of cleanliness that is a cut above. I donâ€™t think of Merced --where I went to Junior Collegeâ€”as a romantic destination. Many will be there to visit family as I was or for something related to the University. This accommodation was absolutely perfect and completely self-contained. The appliances all look like they were delivered yesterday, so new are they. Although it was 96 degrees outside, the unit has central air and ceiling fans and I remained comfortably cool the entire time. It has its own private entrance which is easily accessed without the necessity of keys through a numeric key pad. Other reviewers have mentioned ambient sounds from the host family in the main house. No question. At times you will hear signs of life from next door including the indistinct voice of a child. If you are here for a honeymoon getaway, this may not be your cup of tea. However, when it counts â€”when itâ€™s time to wind down for bed and throughout the nightâ€” this place is as quiet as a tomb. You are unlikely to find a more quiet place for when it counts. There is a delightful little park 60 seconds away and the entire neighborhood is a quiet and safe oasis. Single women traveling will especially appreciate this aspect. Although in a newer and non-central part of town, that, for me, we as desirable for its peace and tranquility. You will have a car and can quickly get anywhere in this small town you care to go. The hosts could not have been kinder or more responsive. Make sure you open the hallway closest as I did not until five minutes before I left. Brand new washer/dryer for you inside with enough soap etc for a single wash (so bring some laundry supplies with you). I am so glad that I chose this accommodation and am pleased that I in a small way supported a fine, working family rather than a distant corporation by staying in motel row. This felt more like a house than a hotel room as it is quite large.

review_text:
Kemi and Paul's Airbnb was wonderful. The neighborhood looks new, and is peaceful, safe, and quiet. There is a large neighborhood park across the street and plenty of street parking. The space itself was very private, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable, the fridge and microwave were large and clean, and they even provided some small appliances (hot plate and coffee maker). There is also a very nice, late model private washer and dryer which were a huge bonus for us. This was not only very convenient, but so much cleaner and more effective than a laundromat. Everything was very clean.
Another reviewer mentioned hearing a child in the main unit. It's true that if you require total silence in your living space, you should be aware that this is unit is part of their house so you may occasionally hear the normal sounds of life through the walls. Overall our experience was very private and quiet.
Thank you Kemi and Paul!

Very clean and well maintained. The property seemed recently renovated and there were nice updates like no touch soap and trash barrels, remote controlled blinds, and smart dimmers.
Marcus and Amara were very responsive and welcomed us with a nice note and welcome basket.
The home is in a quiet area. We could read by the pool and be to downtown Merced restaurants within 6-8 minutes, and Modesto is about 40-45 minutes. Also very central to UC Merced for anyone visiting the campus.
The home was spacious and we were able to keep our luggage stored and out of the way. A true home experience with timely landscaping and pool maintenance. Great linens, comfortable beds, and furniture.
Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a quiet, well-appointed home experience that is still central to Merced attractions or a moderate ride to Yosemite, etc.

Upon arrival check in was extremely seamless and when walking in we immediately noticed how clean the home smelled and how neat and tidy it was.
There are instructions on how to use all the smarthome features mounted in little frames throughout the house which we thought was very cool and helpful.
The kitchen had all we need to cook a nice meal, and the weber kettle grill came in handy to grill up some steaks by the pool.
The pool was very clean, and Target is not far from the home. They had the pool toys we needed!
Overall we highly recommend this home for anyone looking for a little getaway and is visiting Merced.
Well be back for sure!

review_text: My family (two parents with two adult children) needed a place to stay in Merced because of a family event nearby. Marcus' place suited us perfectly - we were very very comfortable and spent a quiet, peaceful night before our event the next day. We appreciated the book Marcus put together with information about restaurants and attractions in the immediate area. We weren't able to use all the amenities such as the pool or barbeque area - but these looked very inviting and if we were in the area during the warmer months we would certainly have taken advantage of those things! A few notable items: the pillows and towels were especially soft and luxurious; the kitchen was well supplied for basic breakfast preparation; the heating and lighting worked very well and we got the place warmed up quickly on a cold evening.

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: So let me start off by saying I have used Airbnb for years and never had an issue this last year I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder type 1 and severe anxiety attacks that lead to seizures my husband and I decided to get a service dog to alert me before an attack we decided to take a family vacation to start of the new year somewhere new and fun and thank god for Marcus because every other host either told me I couldnâ€™t stay or I would be charged extra cleaning fees because of my service dog I was starting to feel very discouraged and ashamed of my disability I decided to ask one more place which was Marcusâ€™s beautiful home and wow he literally made me cry when he answered me back within 5 min of messaging him that he would love to have us and my service dog with no problem and waived the pet fee any questions or concerns I had was answered promptly and at late hours he was still responsive he let us check in early his home was beautiful and clean and he even had a dog bowl set up for Olaf he talked with us and even helped us bring our bags in he understood my disability and was accommodating In every way after dealing with hosts who have made me embarrassed and ashamed of my disability it was truly heartwarming and I am even crying as I write this review because Marcus truly made our family vacation possible and the best way to bring in the new year thank you Marcus we can not wait to come back

review_text: The stay was very nice and homey. Wish we were able to use the pool but got back to the house late so we skipped on it. Marcus was very fast to respond (texted each other) and was there when I needed. The only suggestion that I would have is maybe add some blinds. I'm used to having blinds in the house, this one has blinds in the front of the house and in the bedrooms. The back yard and the bathrooms lacked blinds but other than that no issues with the stay. It has a nice glass table that seats 8 (but we didn't use). Where is located is a little weird, the street doesn't have stop signs so just drive slow and be careful when coming in and out of the neighborhood. The fridge is large and can store a good amount of stuff inside. He also supplied some soda, water bottles, and a bottle of wine for our stay. We will definitely be planning on coming back more often in the future because my in-laws live in Merced.

review_text:
I'm currently in the process of starting up a new business in Merced and I've been driving daily from Elk Grove. Often I would book a hotel in the location which has not always been the best experience so I decided to try Airbnb. This was my first time booking an AirBnB and was a bit disappointed, because my first attempts did not receive a response from hosts. A week later I gave the site one more try and this is when I found Marcus Place........
Well I have to say Marcus Place did not disappoint. I'm very into technology so the fact that the entire house had been upgraded to smart home features was plus. Also the home was very clean and in a great neighborhood. There's a nice size clean pool in the backyard with hot tube to match. Plus the added touch of bottled wine waiting for me really was great.
Upon returning the key I was a bit late because got called into the work early that morning, from which I text Marcus and he was totally fine with me dropping key off later in the day. While dropping key off, I was able to meet Mr. Marcus. Great down to earth you man who was very welcoming and pleasant to talk to. Needless to say, I will be staying at Marcus Place again in the near future.
Thanks again Marcus.

Max was quick to respond and very understanding in allowing us to have family over as we grieved. He also allowed us to have my sisterâ€™s small family stay with us for two nights (there were 8 of us total) for an extra fee (typically he doesnâ€™t allow more than one family to stay at a time, but we had an unexpected situation arise, and he was flexible and accommodating in our tough situation). name: Andrea

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed about a week
review_text:
This is a very generous residence for a family, with a beautiful kitchen, dining and living room in a large, open space with high ceilings, three smaller bedrooms with queen beds, and a master suite with connected full bath. Thereâ€™s a second full bath in the hallway between the bedrooms. The house has plenty of storage space, and is fully equipped to make oneself at home away from home. Thereâ€™s also a nice back yard with dining furniture. All appliances and furnishings are new. It comes fully stocked with towels, linen, kitchen equipment, spices, and staples to get you started.
The neighborhood is as new as the home, and very peaceful and quiet, especially at night. I slept really well in the comfortable bed, and felt very safe and cozy.
Whatever it is that brings you to Merced, donâ€™t miss the wildlife reserves. I saw hundreds of geese, pelicans, a huge variety of ducks, raptors, sparrows, herons and egrets, the rare Sandhill Cranes and Tule Elksâ€¦ all just a 30 minutes drive away. Magical!
Communication with host Max was outstanding. Heâ€™s so accommodating, resourceful and helpful, and really wants you to have the best of times. I wanted to extend my stay because it was just so nice, but the house was booked. Max went out of his way with recommendations and suggestions, really fabulous.
In other words, highly recommended.

We stayed here as a group of 5 on our trip to Yosemite and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. It was a newer construction with modern amenities, located in a peaceful community, was easy to find, and the host Ram was very responsive and accommodative of our requests.
The house was clean, had all the amenities and the kitchen was well stocked. The host also allowed us to park our car inside closed garage which was an added bonus.
We would certainly love to come back here on our future trips to Yosemite!!
